column7: Description
column9: How To Do It
column18: Notes

column7: Required by both stores. Must detail data collection, storage, usage, third-party sharing, user rights (GDPR/CCPA).
column9:
1. Use privacy policy generator (iubenda.com or privacypolicies.com)
2. Customize for your data practices
3. Host on your website/GitHub Pages
4. Add URL to app stores and in-app settings
column10: Website or hosting for policy page
column18: Complete privacy policy with data collection tables. Ready to host.

column7: User agreement for app usage. Required for both stores.
column9:
1. Use ToS generator (termly.io or similar)
2. Include user conduct rules, liability limitations
3. Cover community guidelines
4. Host publicly
column18: Complete ToS with all sections. Ready to host.

column7: End User License Agreement required for iOS apps.
column9:
1. Apple provides standard EULA
2. Can customize if needed
3. Add to App Store Connect metadata
column18: Can use Apple's standard EULA

column7: Required to publish on Play Store. One-time registration fee.
column9:
1. Go to play.google.com/console
2. Sign in with Google account
3. Pay $25 one-time fee
4. Complete account details
5. Verify identity (can take 48hrs)
column18: $25 one-time fee. Use business account if possible

column7: Required to publish on App Store. Annual subscription.
column9:
1. Go to developer.apple.com/enroll
2. Sign in with Apple ID
3. Pay $99/year
4. Complete enrollment (can take 48hrs)
column18: $99/year recurring. Required for iOS distribution

column7: Gauge interest before launch. Collect early adopters emails.
column9:
1. Create landing page on Framer (free tier)
2. Add compelling headline and app preview
3. Integrate Formspree/Formsspark for email collection
4. Add social proof and features preview
5. Set up thank you page with social sharing
column18: Framer free tier works. Formsspark free: 250 submissions/month

column7: Nurture waitlist subscribers until launch.
column9:
1. Use Loops.so or Mailchimp for email automation
2. Create welcome email for signup
3. Create 2-3 teaser emails with feature previews
4. Create launch day announcement email
5. Schedule sequence
column18: Loops.so free: 1000 contacts. Mailchimp free: 500 contacts

column7: Grove - ensure name is available on both stores.
column9:
1. Search Play Store for 'Grove'
2. Search App Store for 'Grove'
3. If taken, consider 'Grove Community' or similar
4. Update app.json with final name
column18: Current name: Grove

column7: 1024x1024 icon for stores. Multiple sizes for devices.
column9:
1. Design 1024x1024 master icon
2. Use icon generators for all sizes
3. Android: Adaptive icon (foreground + background)
4. iOS: Solid corners (system rounds them)
5. Update assets in expo project
column18: Icons exist in docs/assets. Verify final quality

column7: 1024x500 banner for Play Store listing.
column9:
1. Design landscape banner
2. Include app name and tagline
3. Showcase key feature or screenshots
4. Follow Google's design guidelines
column18: Required for Play Store. Can use Canva free. Guidelines in docs.

column7: Store listing screenshots - CRITICAL for conversion.
column9:
1. Use TheScreenshotFirstCompany or similar service
2. Capture 8 key screens per device size
3. Add compelling captions and context frames
4. A/B test different styles
5. Include lifestyle/mockup versions
column18: Professional screenshots increase downloads 25-35%. Worth the investment.

column7: 15-30 second video showing app in action.
column9:
1. Screen record key user flows
2. Add captions and music
3. iOS: 1920x1080 or device resolution
4. Android: YouTube video link
5. Edit with iMovie/Premiere/Canva
column18: Optional but highly recommended. Free tools available

column6: Write App Store Description with ASO
column7: Short and full description optimized for search.
column9:
1. Use AppTweak, SensorTower, or ASO.dev for keyword research
2. Write compelling 80-char short description
3. Write 4000-char full description with keywords
4. Highlight key features with bullet points
5. Include call-to-action
column18: Copy-paste ready. Subtitle, promotional text, full description included.

column7: 100-character keyword field for App Store search.
column9:
1. Research competitor keywords
2. Use ASO tool for keyword suggestions
3. Prioritize high-traffic low-competition keywords
4. Include location terms if relevant
5. Update keywords after launch based on data
column18: 97 chars optimized: community,events,groups,organizer,RWA,club,association,polls,tasks,meetings,members,social,planning

column7: What's new in this version for each release.
column9:
1. List new features
2. Mention bug fixes
3. Keep it concise and user-friendly
4. Update with each release
column18: v1.0.0 notes complete + template for future releases

column6: Configure App Bundle ID / Package Name
column7: Unique identifier for the Grove app. Cannot change after publish.
column9:
1. Choose format: com.grove.app or similar
2. Update app.json ios.bundleIdentifier
3. Update app.json android.package
4. Ensure consistency
column18: Current: com.grove.app - verify availability on stores

column7: Generate and secure upload key for Play Store.
column9:
1. EAS Build handles this automatically
2. Or generate manually: keytool -genkey
3. Store keystore securely (backup!)
4. Never lose the keystore
column18: CRITICAL: Backup keystore. Loss = new app listing. EAS handles this.

column7: Certificates and provisioning profiles.
column9:
1. EAS Build handles automatically
2. Or manually: Create distribution certificate
3. Create App Store provisioning profile
4. Match bundle ID exactly
column18: EAS simplifies this significantly

column7: Configure Expo Application Services for builds.
column9:
1. Install eas-cli: npm install -g eas-cli
2. Run: eas login
3. Run: eas build:configure
4. Configure eas.json for production builds
5. Test with: eas build --platform all
column18: Already configured in eas.json with development, preview, production profiles

column7: Generate AAB file for Play Store.
column9:
1. Update version in app.json
2. Run: eas build --platform android --profile production
3. Wait for build to complete
4. Download AAB file
column18: AAB required (not APK) for new apps on Play Store

column7: Generate IPA file for App Store.
column9:
1. Update version in app.json
2. Run: eas build --platform ios --profile production
3. Wait for build to complete
4. Submit directly or download IPA
column18: Can submit directly from EAS to App Store Connect

column7: Set up FCM and APNS for production.
column9:
1. Create Firebase project (if not exists)
2. Download google-services.json
3. Create APNs key in Apple Developer
4. Upload to Expo/EAS
5. Test notifications
column18: FCM is free. APNS included in dev account

column7: Track user behavior, retention, and drop-off points.
column9:
1. Integrate Mixpanel, Amplitude, or PostHog
2. Track key events: signup, create_community, invite, event_create
3. Set up funnels for core user journeys
4. Create retention cohorts
5. Set up dashboards for daily review
column18: PostHog free: 1M events/mo. Mixpanel free: 100K events/mo. CRITICAL for understanding churn.

column7: Configure Sentry or similar for production.
column9:
1. Create Sentry project
2. Add expo-sentry package
3. Configure dsn and settings
4. Test error reporting
5. Set up alerts
column18: Free tier: 5K errors/month

column7: Ensure Supabase is production-ready.
column9:
1. Enable RLS on all tables
2. Set up proper auth redirect URLs
3. Configure rate limiting
4. Set up database backups
5. Review security policies
column18: Free tier sufficient for launch. Upgrade as needed

column7: Configure production environment.
column9:
1. Set SUPABASE_URL and ANON_KEY
2. Configure GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID
3. Set up API keys in EAS secrets
4. Verify all production URLs
column18: Use EAS Secrets for sensitive values

column7: Collect feature requests and feedback from users.
column9:
1. Create Canny account (free tier)
2. Set up feedback board categories
3. Customize branding
4. Add feedback link in app settings
5. Configure email notifications for new feedback
column18: Canny free: 100 tracked users. Essential for product roadmap.

column7: Test with internal team before public.
column9:
1. Create internal test track in Play Console
2. Upload AAB
3. Add tester emails (up to 100)
4. Share opt-in link
5. Gather feedback
column18: Fastest approval, no review needed

column7: Beta testing with TestFlight.
column9:
1. Upload build to App Store Connect
2. Add internal testers (up to 100)
3. Submit for external beta (up to 10,000)
4. Gather feedback via TestFlight
column18: External TestFlight requires review

column7: Fill in all required store listing details.
column9:
1. Upload app icon
2. Upload feature graphic
3. Upload professional screenshots
4. Write optimized descriptions
5. Complete content rating questionnaire
6. Set pricing (free)
7. Select countries
column18: Descriptions + Data Safety answers ready. Need screenshots + feature graphic.

column7: Fill in all App Store Connect details.
column9:
1. Create new app in App Store Connect
2. Upload screenshots for all sizes
3. Write descriptions
4. Add optimized keywords (100 chars max)
5. Set pricing (free)
6. Answer export compliance questions
column18: Descriptions + Keywords + Privacy answers ready. Need screenshots.

column7: Submit app for Google Play review.
column9:
1. Complete all store listing sections
2. Upload AAB to production track
3. Answer data safety questionnaire
4. Submit for review
5. Wait for approval (usually 1-3 days)
column18: First review may take longer

column7: Submit app for App Store review.
column9:
1. Complete all App Store Connect sections
2. Upload build via EAS or Transporter
3. Select build for review
4. Answer review questions
5. Submit for review (usually 1-2 days)
column18: First review may take longer. Common rejections: crashes, broken links

column7: Handle rejection or requests.
column9:
1. Read rejection reason carefully
2. Fix issues mentioned
3. Submit updated build
4. Write explanation in Resolution Center
5. Resubmit for review
column18: Keep response professional and detailed

column7: Onboard new users and drive engagement.
column9:
1. Use Loops.so for email automation
2. Welcome email (immediate): Thank user, highlight key features
3. Day 2: How to create your first community
4. Day 5: Tips for engaging members
5. Day 7 inactivity: Ask for feedback, offer help
6. Day 14: Feature education (events, finance)
7. Day 30: Ask for app store review
column18: Loops.so free: 1000 contacts. Email sequences increase retention 30%+

column7: Website for app promotion and SEO.
column9:
1. Create simple landing page (Framer/Carrd.co free)
2. Include screenshots and features
3. Add store badges with links
4. Add privacy policy link
5. Set up domain (optional)
column18: Can use free hosting initially

column7: Create presence for Grove.
column9:
1. Create Twitter/X account (@GroveCommunity)
2. Create Instagram account
3. Create LinkedIn page (optional)
4. Plan content calendar
5. Share updates, tips, and user stories
column18: Organic social is free

column7: Ongoing optimization for store visibility.
column9:
1. Monitor keyword rankings weekly
2. A/B test icons and screenshots
3. Encourage ratings and reviews
4. Respond to all user reviews
5. Update keywords based on performance data
column18: AppTweak or SensorTower for tracking

column7: Maximize visibility on launch day.
column9:
1. Prepare launch announcement posts
2. Email waitlist with download links
3. Post on Product Hunt (optional)
4. Share in relevant communities (Reddit, Facebook groups)
5. Reach out to early adopters for reviews
column18: Product Hunt can drive significant traffic

column7: Build organic traffic through content.
column9:
1. Start a blog (Medium or own site)
2. Write about community management tips
3. Case studies of successful communities
4. SEO-optimized articles
5. Share on social media
column18: Long-term strategy. Takes 3-6 months to see results

column7: Partner with community leaders.
column9:
1. Identify local community group leaders
2. Offer free premium features for testimonials
3. Create case studies together
4. Get video testimonials
5. Feature on landing page
column18: Word of mouth is powerful for community apps

column7: Handle user questions and issues.
column9:
1. Create support email (support@grove.app)
2. Set up FAQ/Help section in app
3. Configure auto-replies
4. Create response templates
5. Monitor reviews for issues
column18: Start with free email. Intercom later

column7: Track and respond to store reviews.
column9:
1. Enable email notifications in store consoles
2. Use AppFollow or similar (optional)
3. Respond to negative reviews within 24h
4. Thank positive reviewers
5. Track trends and common issues
column18: Manual monitoring is free. Reviews impact ranking.

column7: Standard process for updates.
column9:
1. Document version numbering scheme
2. Create release checklist
3. Set up staging environment
4. Plan testing before each release
5. Communicate updates to users
column18: Document in team wiki/docs

column7: Ask happy users for reviews at right moments.
column9:
1. Integrate expo-store-review
2. Trigger after positive moments (event success, milestone)
3. Don't ask too early (wait 7+ days)
4. Respect user choice (don't ask again if declined)
5. A/B test timing
column18: Good reviews boost ranking significantly

column7: In-app referral for organic growth.
column9:
1. Design referral flow (unique invite links)
2. Track referrals in Supabase
3. Reward referrers (premium features/recognition)
4. Show referral leaderboard
5. Promote within app
column18: Can implement with Supabase. Most powerful growth lever.

column7: Build a community for Grove users.
column9:
1. Create Discord/Slack for power users
2. Host virtual meetups/webinars
3. Share best practices and tips
4. Gather feedback directly
5. Create ambassador program
column18: Meta-community of community organizers

column7: European data protection requirements.
column9:
1. Add cookie consent (if web)
2. Allow data export from settings
3. Allow account deletion
4. Document data processing
5. Update privacy policy
column18: Required if targeting EU users

column7: If app may be used by children.
column9:
1. Determine if app targets children
2. Add age verification if needed
3. Limit data collection from minors
4. Update privacy policy
column18: Grove targets adults (community organizers)

column7: Translate app for new markets.
column9:
1. Identify target markets (Hindi, Tamil, etc.)
2. Extract strings for translation
3. Use professional translators or Lokalise
4. Update store listings per language
5. Test with native speakers
column18: Can significantly expand market. Start with 1-2 languages.

column7: Get press coverage for credibility.
column9:
1. Write press release
2. Create media kit (screenshots, logos, story)
3. Identify relevant tech/local journalists
4. Pitch story angle (local community revival)
5. Prepare for interviews
column18: PR can be expensive. Start with organic outreach.

column7: Roadmap for monetization.
column9:
1. Analyze free tier usage
2. Identify power user features (analytics, export)
3. Design subscription tiers
4. Integrate Stripe/RevenueCat
5. A/B test pricing
column18: Wait until you have active users. Don't rush monetization.

column7: Understand where users drop off.
column9:
1. Define key funnels: Signup > Create Community > Invite > First Event
2. Track each step in analytics
3. Identify biggest drop-off points
4. Create weekly funnel reports
5. Prioritize improvements based on data
column18: Critical for understanding user behavior

column7: Track cohort retention to measure product health.
column9:
1. Set up cohort analysis in analytics tool
2. Track Day 1, Day 7, Day 30 retention
3. Compare retention by acquisition source
4. Identify features that correlate with retention
5. Focus on improving D7 retention first
column18: Retention is the key metric for product-market fit

column7: Regular check on app health.
column9:
1. Schedule weekly 30-min review
2. Check: DAU/WAU, new signups, retention
3. Review funnel drop-offs
4. Read new feedback/reviews
5. Prioritize action items
column18: Discipline to review data regularly is key

column7: Fill out App Store Connect privacy labels based on data collection and usage.
column9: App Store Connect > App Privacy > answer data types, tracking, data linked to user. Align with privacy policy.
column18: Pre-filled answers provided in documentation. Required for App Review.

column7: Declare data collection, sharing, and security practices in Play Console.
column9: Play Console > App content > Data safety. Map to privacy policy and SDKs used.
column18: Pre-filled answers provided in documentation. Required before production release.

column6: Prepare App Review Notes + Demo Account
column7: Provide reviewer instructions and test credentials if login is required.
column9: Create reviewer account, list steps to access core features, add in App Store Connect and Play Console.
column18: Complete instructions for both stores + SQL script for demo data setup.

column7: Set Support URL and Marketing URL in store listings.
column9: Use landing page or docs site. Ensure privacy policy URL is reachable.
column18: Support URL is mandatory for iOS.

column7: Install the production build and complete critical flows end-to-end.
column9: Test login, community creation, invite/join, events, feed, finance, profile.
column18: 50+ test cases with sign-off sheet. Prevents last-minute store rejections.

column7: Show ATT prompt if any tracking is used; otherwise document why not needed.
column9: If using tracking SDKs, add ATT prompt and update privacy labels.
column18: Required if tracking users across apps/sites.
